snippet: The smaller the body, the less the resistance and the less chance for it to get hurt in a fall.
abstract: Science Q&A on whether throwing insects out of an apartment window is likely to injure them. Drawing (M)/
lead_paragraph: Q.I bring home fresh produce from a garden that invariably has little critters embedded, sow bugs and the like. I put them outside on my 19th-floor window ledge, and they crawl or fall away. Do they get hurt? A. Probably not, in the opinion of Ward Wheeler, head of the division of invertebrate zoology at the American Museum of Natural History.
